divs: Sighting Details live in the hills approximately 10 - 15 miles north of Los Angeles where the light pollution backs off a little bit. Last evening at approximately 10:00pm I went in my backyard (as usual) to have a smoke before bed. I always scan the night sky before retiring as it helps me to relax from my hectic activities. I first spotted what appeared to be a satellite travelling south by southeast at a pretty decent clip from over the city. I have observed satellites before and was not surprised to see one and figured I would just track it for as long as conditions allowed. After it passed overhead, I observed the light cut west 90 degrees followed by another 90 degree cut back south in rapid succession. Now, my first thought was: "I don���t think satellites exactly have the capability to re route themselves like that." And then it happened - the craft stopped, hovered for maybe 15 - 20 seconds, and shot straight east at an incredible amount of speed. So fast, it left a quick streak before dissolving into nothing. The whole sighting lasted maybe 120 seconds.
